problem: Two particles of mass m₁ and m₂ respectively, travels with an initial speed v₀ but with different angles as shown in the right figure. After the two collide, they both fly out with an angle 45° with respect to the horizontal. Find the final speed v₁ and v₂ of the two particles respectively. You can use sin(30°) = cos(60°) = 1/2, cos(30°) = sin(60°) = √3/2, and sin(45°) = cos(45°) = √2/2.

correctFormulas.name: Momentum conservation (x- and y-components)
correctFormulas.formula: m₁ v₀ cos30° − m₂ v₀ cos60° = m₁ v₁ cos45° − m₂ v₂ cos45°

correctFormulas.name: Momentum conservation (y-direction)
correctFormulas.formula: m₁ v₀ sin30° + m₂ v₀ sin60° = m₁ v₁ sin45° + m₂ v₂ sin45°

steps.explanation: Insert the given trigonometric values and solve the two linear equations for v₁ and v₂.
These expressions ensure both momentum components are conserved; the actual magnitudes depend on the mass ratio.
steps.notations: Use the chosen geometry from the figure when applying the formulas.
